singlecellmultiomics.molecule package¶

Submodules¶

singlecellmultiomics.molecule.molecule module¶

class singlecellmultiomics.molecule.molecule.Molecule(fragments=None, cache_size=10000)[source]¶

Bases: object

Molecule class, contains one or more associated fragments

fragments¶

list – associated fragments

spanStart¶

int – starting coordinate of molecule, None if not available

spanEnd¶

int – ending coordinate of molecule, None if not available

chromosome¶

str – mapping chromosome of molecule, None if not available

cache_size¶

int – radius of molecule assignment cache

strand¶

bool – mapping strand. True when strand is REVERSE False when strand is FORWARD None when strand is not determined

Obtain a fragment belonging to this molecule.

Returns:fragment (singlecellmultiomics.fragment.Fragment)

can_be_yielded(chromosome, position)[source]¶

Check if the molecule is far enough away from the supplied location to be ejected from a buffer.

Parameters:

  • position (int) – genomic location of location to test

can_be_yielded (bool)

iter_reads()[source]¶

Iterate over all associated reads :returns: generator (pysam.AlignedSegment)

singlecellmultiomics.molecule.molecule.MoleculeIterator(alignments, moleculeClass=<class 'singlecellmultiomics.molecule.molecule.Molecule'>, fragmentClass=<class 'singlecellmultiomics.fragment.fragment.Fragment'>, check_eject_every=1000, molecule_class_args={}, fragment_class_args={}, **pysamArgs)[source]¶

Iterate over molecules in pysam.AlignmentFile

Parameters:
  • alignments (pysam.AlignmentFile) – Alignments to extract molecules form
  • moleculeClass (pysam.FastaFile) – Class to use for molecules.
  • fragmentClass (pysam.FastaFile) – Class to use for fragments.
  • check_eject_every (int) – Check for yielding every N reads.
  • molecule_class_args (dict) – arguments to pass to moleculeClass.
  • fragment_class_args (dict) – arguments to pass to fragmentClass.
  • **kwargs – arguments to pass to the pysam.AlignmentFile.fetch function
Yields:

methylation_status (dict) – { tuple(chrom,pos): converted (bool) }
